bug.author: karriebear
bug.summary: Page Config check is problematic when deployed.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The error that is thrown if page config is run multiple times or is not the first run shows up on rerun. For some reason, this only seems to happen when deployed. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Deploy this code sample to heroku
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import pandas as pd
st.beta_set_page_config( page_title="{0}", page_icon="{1}", layout="wide", initial_sidebar_state="collapsed" )
options = pd.DataFrame({'Options': ['radio', 'multiselect', 'selectbox']})
st.radio("Dataframe as input for radio buttons", options) </denchmark-code>
Switch between radios a variable amount of times to cause reruns.
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Nothing <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24946400/90166542-6d669c80-dd68-11ea-83a6-e928b4598d61.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: My try/except workaround seems to be working as expected! ðŸ™‚

Thanks for the info <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ZupoLlask>@ZupoLlask</denchmark-link> and apologies we missed your comment. Just curious, we've been having problems reproducing the issue locally so was curious to know if you got this when running locally or just when deployed?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karriebear>@karriebear</denchmark-link> , I'm getting this when deployed but I cannot tell you if it is more frequent than running locally. It seems to me that it may be more frequent when the client machine is under heavy CPU load... But it may be coincidence.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ZupoLlask>@ZupoLlask</denchmark-link> Thanks for the information! The latest release 0.65.1 should fix the issue. If you are still getting this issue, please let us know!
